intro: Parabaena denudata, commonly known as the naked parabaena, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or near streams. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
